basics.name: Charlotte (Jiale) Zhou
basics.label: Master's Student in Computational Social Science
basics.summary: Second-year master's student at the University of Chicago focusing on economic consulting, data science, corporate behavior, and labor economics. Passionate about leveraging data and technology to analyze economic impacts and inform policy.

work.name: Haas School of Business, University of California Berkeley
work.summary: Conducted literature review on regulatory practices related to workplace safety and drafted a research proposal on California's AB 701 law. Collected and cleaned OSHA data to perform an event study on injury rates.

work.name: Booth Business School, University of Chicago
work.summary: Collected, verified, and cleaned data on gas flaring activities and asset transactions for oil companies operating in Africa, ensuring accuracy of corporate headquarters and stock exchange listings. Conducted robustness analysis using Stata to validate findings; Drafted sections of online appendix including methodology details and supplementary analyses, contributing to comprehensive documentation of the research.

work.name: China CITIC Securities
work.summary: Conducted in-depth quantitative research on logistics technology companies; Performed competitor analysis and market size analysis; Produced 8-page analysis report of recommended companies for IPO team. Conducted IPO due diligence and filing preparation for real estate company; Verified relevant financial information and compiled the drafts; Assisted in writing public offering prospectus report.

education.institution: The Chinese University of Hong Kong, Shenzhen

projects.name: Mining Detection in Ghana using Satellite Data
projects.summary: Leveraged AWS cloud computing to process large datasets, applying machine learning techniques such as Random Forests and Convolutional Neural Networks to analyze geospatial features and predict mining activities.

projects.name: Sentiment Analysis of ESG Disclosures
